title: Asian Youth Athletics Championships
text:
The Asian Youth Athletics Championships is a biennial, continental <a href="athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a> competition for Asian athletes, organised by the <a href="Asian%20Athletics%20Association">Asian Athletics Association</a>. First held in 2015, it a <a href="youth%20%28athletics%29">youth category</a> event open to athletes aged fifteen and seventeen. The competition was the fourth continental athletics competition to be held for that age level, following in the steps of the <a href="South%20American%20Youth%20Championships%20in%20Athletics">South American</a>, <a href="Oceania%20Youth%20Athletics%20Championships">Oceanian</a> and <a href="African%20Youth%20Athletics%20Championships">African</a> events. Its first edition came at a time of rising interest in such competitions, with the first African championships being held in 2013, and the <a href="European%20Athletics%20Youth%20Championships">European Athletics Youth Championships</a> scheduled for the following year. In March 2014, the Asian Athletics Association's president <a href="Dahlan%20Jumaan%20al-Hamad">Dahlan Jumaan al-Hamad</a> cited the creation of the championships as a way of boosting the <a href="grassroots">grassroots</a>-level development of the sport in Asia and raise the importance of continental level competition among the region's countries.
All-time medal table.
As of 2019
